ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5-6 hours
About 10
10 hours weekly for placement and journal writing.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I think the course was great and allowed me to develop skills during my practicum that i had not had before.
Phenomenal learning experience.
Good course for public health practice, but time is to short, which lead to an intense schedule for this course
Great opportunity to get community health experience
Excellent opportunity to perform virtually independent practical project in the field of public health

Excellent course to introduce APMPH students to public health practice. Dr. O'Keefe and Dr. Frankel-Gramelis are very knowledgeable in the field and could provide additional insight for each student in their placement.
Excellent
I think the practicum is a great component of the course, but it definitely requires planning time. If it is not planned well ahead it can turn into something other than what you want it to be.

This course might be more effective is spread over the fall and spring semesters. Many students had a hard time achieving what they needed to with only the spring semester to work with (especially if IRB approval was needed).

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Great! very responsive. worked diligently on any problems that students brought to her.
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Very helpful.
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Nice lady, ready to help
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Very approachable and understanding

Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Outstanding instructor and expert to guide the students through the practicum, I was very impressed with her HIV activist work (also during Frontiers lectures), great asset for the practicum curriculum and YSPH
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Excellent instructor, knowledgeable, and highly experienced in public health practice.
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  Great!
Instructor: Elaine O'Keefe  always ready to help, give her expert advice. Elaine and Diane were a great asset.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course if you want to do something autonomous. Great capstone for the end of your MPH where you can prove to yourself that you definitely can utilize the skills that your academics has taught you.
Would recommend.
Good course to practice and build connection
I would recommend this course because it is the one of the few courses that allow you the autonomy to run a whole project on your own using all the public health skills you have learned

Your experience will depend on your chosen topic and individual mentor but the current YSPH practicum faculty (Elaine and Diane) are outstanding and very skilled in understanding the practical and public health aspect of each student's project. Note that 12 weeks is not enough to finish a major undertaking especially if it involves an IRB approval but this is not a main point of this practicum and will not count against you, highly recommended!!!
Great course to immerse yourself in public health practice.
Plan ahead so that the practicum can be a relevant experience. If prepared for, this can be a great class to take.
Great if you have an existing project you wish to work on independently.
Would highly recommend
